content:
11. During the confirmation of the covenant, Moses was 
invited by the Lord along with 
A. Aaron, Nadab and Abihu 
B. Aaron, Eleazar and Nadab 
C. Abihu, Eleazar and Nadab 
D. Eleazar, Aaron and Abihu. 
 
12. ‘Go into the hills, lest the pursuers meet you; and hide 
yourselves three days, until the pursurers have 
returned; then afterwards you may go your way’. Who 
gave this advice? 
A. Deborah B. Rebekah C. Rahab D. Sihon 
 
13. When Joshua burned Ai, he also put to death the king 
of Ai, by 
A. burning B. stoning C. hanging D. shooting. 
 
14. In Jothams’s parable of the trees, Abimelech is very 
much likened to the 
A. fig B.  bramble C. olive D. vine 
 
15. The preservation of the twelve stones by Joshua in Gilgal 
was to 
A. constitute a museum 
B. found a place of worship 
C. remind Israel of the crossing of River Jordan 
D. indicate that the site was a quarry. 
 
16. Samson, as a Nazarite, was required to avoid alcohol 
A. women and dead lions 
B. unclean things and shacing 
C. shaving and swearing 
D. shaving and women. 
 
17. Which city was captured by Joshua before the disaster 
at Ai? 
A. Bethel B. Jericho C. Hebron D. Gilgal 
 
18. ‘I have brought Agag the king of Amalek, and I have 
utterly destroyed the Amalekites.’ This declaration was 
made by 
A. David B. Solomon C. Samuel D. Saul 
 
19. ‘O Lord of hosts, if thou will ... give to thy maidservant 
a son, then I will give him to the Lord all the days of his 
life, and no razor shall touch his head’. Who said this? 
A. Sarah B. Rachael C. Hannah D. Samson’s 
mother. 
 
20. Eli fell down and died because of the 
A. defeat of the Israelites 
B. behaviour of his delinquent children 
C. capture of the Ark of Covenant 
D. death of his two children 
 
21. “Then Saul fell at once full lenght upon the ground, 
filled with fear because of the words of Samuel; and 
there was no strenght in him ...” This happened when 
Samuel 
A. rebuked Saul for sparing Agag 
B. told Saul that God had rejected him and had 
chosen David to be king 
C. condemned Saul for offering sacrifice before his 
arrival 
D. was invoked from the dea. 
22. Ammon’s incest with Tamar marks the begining of 
A. the intrigues for succession to the throne 
B. David’s popularity 
C. the fame of Solomon’s wisdom 
D. David’s love for Uriah’s wife. 
 
23. As David took to flight from Jerusalem on account of 
Absalom’s conspiracy, he was apprehensive of the role of 
A. Ahitophel B. Ahijah C. Abiathar D. Shimel. 
 
24. To whom did God promise to give the kingdom after 
Solomon’s heart turned away from the Lord? 
A. Rehoboam B. Ahijah C. Jeroboam D. Jehoram 
 
25. What did Solomon provide for Hiram in exhcnage for 
timber of cedar and cypress? 
A. War equipment B. Food C. Wives D. Money. 
 
26. The gift of gold to the infant, Jesus indicated his 
A. royal  status B. priestly status 
C. prophetic status D.messianic mission. 
 
27. Herod ordered the killing of children when he 
A. learnt that a king was born 
B. had been tricked by the wise men 
C. could not see the new baby 
D. searched in vain for the wise men. 
 
28. ‘And you, O Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, are by no 
means least among the rulers of Judah; for from you 
shall come a ruler who will govern my people Israel.’ 
This statement fulfills the prophesy of 
A. Joel B. Micah C. Amos D. Nahum. 
 
29. According to Mark, what were the disciples forbidden 
to take for their journey? 
A. Gold, silver and bag 
B. Bread, bag and staff 
C. Sandals, staff and two tunics 
D. Bread, bag and money. 
 
30. How many days elapsed between Peter’s confession 
and transfiguration? 
A. Five   B.  Six C. Seven D. Eeight. 
 
31. The young man who wanted to know from Jesus what 
good deed would qualify him for heaven, ‘went away 
sorrowful’ because he 
A. hated the poor 
B. was uncertain about treasure in heaven 
C. had great possessions 
D. would realize little money from the sale of his 
goods. 
 
32. In St. Matthew’s record of the ethnical teaching of Jesus 
(chapters 5-7), the most important divine demand that 
will enable a man inherit the kingdom of God is 
A. doing the will of God 
B. practising charity 
C. prophesying  
D. perfoming miracles. 
33. The answer ‘You are the Christ, the son of the living 
God’ was made by Peter in the neighbourhood of 
A. Bethlehem in Judea 
B. Capernum 
C. Caesarea 
D. Bethsaida.
